info.title: Deribit API
info.description: Deribit API v2.1.1 - REST API for cryptocurrency derivatives trading

tags.name: WebSocket Only
tags.description: Can only be used over websockets.

tags.name: Public
tags.description: Public methods can be used without authentication.

tags.name: Private
tags.description: Private methods require authentication. All requests must include a valid OAuth2 token. A token can be requested using the [/public/auth](#public-auth) method. When using the websockets protocol, the token must be included as a parameter `access_token` in the message. When using REST (HTTP GET), the token may also be passed in the `Authorization` header.

tags.name: Subscription Management
tags.description: Subscription works as [notifications](#notifications), so users will automatically (after subscribing) receive messages from the server. Overview for each channel response format is described in [subscriptions](#subscriptions) section.

Retrieve an Oauth access token, to be used for authentication of 'private' requests. Three methods of authentication are supported: - `client_credentials` - using the client id and client secret that can be found on the API page on the website - `client_signature` - using the client id that can be found on the API page on the website and user generated signature. The signature is calculated using some fields provided in the request, using formula described here [Deribit signature credentials](#additional-authorization-method-signature-credentials-websocket-api) - `refresh_token` - using a refresh token that was received from an earlier invocation The response will contain an access token, expiration period (number of seconds that the token is valid) and a refresh token that can be used to get a new set of tokens. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [API Authentication Guide](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/29748629634205-API-Authentication-Guide)

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: Method of authentication

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Required for grant type `client_credentials` and `client_signature`

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: Required for grant type `client_credentials`

parameters.name: refresh_token
parameters.description: Required for grant type `refresh_token`

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Required for grant type `client_signature`, provides time when request has been generated (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch)

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: Required for grant type `client_signature`; it's a cryptographic signature calculated over provided fields using user **secret key**. The signature should be calculated as an HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code) with `SHA256` hash algorithm

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: Optional for grant type `client_signature`; delivers user generated initialization vector for the server token

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Optional for grant type `client_signature`; contains any user specific value

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Will be passed back in the response

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Describes type of the access for assigned token, possible values: `connection`, `session:name`, `trade:[read, read_write, none]`, `wallet:[read, read_write, none]`, `account:[read, read_write, none]`, `expires:NUMBER`, `ip:ADDR`. Details are elucidated in [Access scope](#access-scope)

get.description: This method returns a list of Block RFQs that were either created by the user or assigned to them as a maker, sorted in descending order. `trades` and `mark_price` are only visible for the filled Block RFQ. When a `block_rfq_id` is specified, only that particular Block RFQ will be returned. If called by a `taker`, response will additionally include `makers` list and `label` if previously provided. If called by the `maker`, the `trades` will include the maker's alias, but only for trades in which this maker participated. Can be optionally filtered by currency.

get.description: Verifies and creates block trade signature **Note:** In the API, the `direction` field is always expressed from the maker's perspective. This means that when you accept a block trade as a taker, the direction shown in the API represents the opposite side of your trade. For example, if you are buying puts as a taker, the API will show the operation as a "sell put" (maker's perspective), and you will be verifying and accepting a "sell put" block trade. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Block Trading](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25944688627229-Block-Trading)

get.description: Creates block trade The whole request have to be exact the same as in `private/verify_block_trade`, only `role` field should be set appropriately - it basically means that both sides have to agree on the same `timestamp`, `nonce`, `trades` fields and server will assure that `role` field is different between sides (each party accepted own role). Using the same `timestamp` and `nonce` by both sides in `private/verify_block_trade` assures that even if unintentionally both sides execute given block trade with valid `counterparty_signature`, the given block trade will be executed only once. **Note:** In the API, the `direction` field is always expressed from the maker's perspective. This means that when you accept a block trade as a taker, the direction shown in the API represents the opposite side of your trade. For example, if you are buying puts as a taker, the API will show the operation as a "sell put" (maker's perspective), and you will be verifying and accepting a "sell put" block trade. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Block Trading](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25944688627229-Block-Trading)

parameters.description: Signature of block trade that will be invalidated

Provides a list of pending block trade approvals. `timestamp` and `nonce` received in response can be used to approve or reject the pending block trade. To use a block trade approval feature the additional API key setting feature called: `enabled_features: block_trade_approval` is required. This key has to be given to broker/registered partner who performs the trades on behalf of the user for the feature to be active. If the user wants to approve the trade, he has to approve it from different API key with doesn't have this feature enabled.

get.description: Signals the Websocket connection to send and request heartbeats. Heartbeats can be used to detect stale connections. When heartbeats have been set up, the API server will send `heartbeat` messages and `test_request` messages. Your software should respond to `test_request` messages by sending a `/api/v2/public/test` request. If your software fails to do so, the API server will immediately close the connection. If your account is configured to cancel on disconnect, any orders opened over the connection will be cancelled.
Stop sending heartbeat messages.

Enable Cancel On Disconnect for the connection. After enabling, all orders created via this connection will be automatically cancelled when the connection is closed. Cancel is triggered in the following cases: when the TCP connection is properly terminated, when the connection is closed due to 10 minutes of inactivity, or when a heartbeat detects a disconnection. To reduce the inactivity timeout, consider using [public/set_heartbeat](https://docs.deribit.com/#public-set_heartbeat). **Note**: If the connection is gracefully closed using [private/logout](https://docs.deribit.com/#private-logout), cancel-on-disconnect will **not** be triggered. **Notice**: Cancel-on-Disconnect does not affect orders created by other connections - they will remain active! When change is applied on the `account` scope, then every newly opened connection will start with **active** Cancel on Disconnect.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Specifies if Cancel On Disconnect change should be applied/checked for the current connection or the account (default - `connection`) **NOTICE:** Scope `connection` can be used only when working via Websocket.

get.description: Disable Cancel On Disconnect for the connection. When change is applied for the account, then every newly opened connection will start with **inactive** Cancel on Disconnect.

get.description: Cancel an order, specified by order id
Places a buy order for an instrument. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Order Management Best Practices](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/29514039279773-Order-Management-Best-Practices)

parameters.name: instrument_name
parameters.description: Instrument name

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: It represents the requested order size. For perpetual and inverse futures the amount is in USD units. For options and linear futures and it is the underlying base currency coin. The `amount` is a mandatory parameter if `contracts` parameter is missing. If both `contracts` and `amount` parameter are passed they must match each other otherwise error is returned.

parameters.name: contracts
parameters.description: It represents the requested order size in contract units and can be passed instead of `amount`. The `contracts` is a mandatory parameter if `amount` parameter is missing. If both `contracts` and `amount` parameter are passed they must match each other otherwise error is returned.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The order type, default: `"limit"`

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: user defined label for the order (maximum 64 characters)

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: The order price in base currency (Only for limit and stop_limit orders) When adding an order with advanced=usd, the field price should be the option price value in USD. When adding an order with advanced=implv, the field price should be a value of implied volatility in percentages. For example, price=100, means implied volatility of 100%

parameters.name: time_in_force
parameters.description: Specifies how long the order remains in effect. Default `"good_til_cancelled"` - `"good_til_cancelled"` - unfilled order remains in order book until cancelled - `"good_til_day"` - unfilled order remains in order book till the end of the trading session - `"fill_or_kill"` - execute a transaction immediately and completely or not at all - `"immediate_or_cancel"` - execute a transaction immediately, and any portion of the order that cannot be immediately filled is cancelled

parameters.name: display_amount
parameters.description: Initial display amount for iceberg order. Has to be at least 100 times minimum amount for instrument and ratio of hidden part vs visible part has to be less than 100 as well.

parameters.name: post_only
parameters.description: If true, the order is considered post-only. If the new price would cause the order to be filled immediately (as taker), the price will be changed to be just below the spread. Only valid in combination with time_in_force=`"good_til_cancelled"`

parameters.name: reject_post_only
parameters.description: If an order is considered post-only and this field is set to true then the order is put to the order book unmodified or the request is rejected. Only valid in combination with `"post_only"` set to true

parameters.name: reduce_only
parameters.description: If `true`, the order is considered reduce-only which is intended to only reduce a current position

parameters.name: trigger_price
parameters.description: Trigger price, required for trigger orders only (Stop-loss or Take-profit orders)

parameters.name: trigger_offset
parameters.description: The maximum deviation from the price peak beyond which the order will be triggered

parameters.name: trigger
parameters.description: Defines the trigger type. Required for `"Stop-Loss"`, `"Take-Profit"` and `"Trailing"` trigger orders

parameters.name: advanced
parameters.description: Advanced option order type. (Only for options. Advanced USD orders are not supported for linear options.)

parameters.name: mmp
parameters.description: Order MMP flag, only for order_type 'limit'

parameters.name: valid_until
parameters.description: Timestamp, when provided server will start processing request in Matching Engine only before given timestamp, in other cases `timed_out` error will be responded. Remember that the given timestamp should be consistent with the server's time, use [/public/time](#public-get_time) method to obtain current server time.

parameters.name: linked_order_type
parameters.description: The type of the linked order. - `"one_triggers_other"` - Execution of primary order triggers the placement of one or more secondary orders. - `"one_cancels_other"` - The execution of one order in a pair automatically cancels the other, typically used to set a stop-loss and take-profit simultaneously. - `"one_triggers_one_cancels_other"` - The execution of a primary order triggers two secondary orders (a stop-loss and take-profit pair), where the execution of one secondary order cancels the other.

parameters.name: trigger_fill_condition
parameters.description: The fill condition of the linked order (Only for linked order types), default: `first_hit`. - `"first_hit"` - any execution of the primary order will fully cancel/place all secondary orders. - `"complete_fill"` - a complete execution (meaning the primary order no longer exists) will cancel/place the secondary orders. - `"incremental"` - any fill of the primary order will cause proportional partial cancellation/placement of the secondary order. The amount that will be subtracted/added to the secondary order will be rounded down to the contract size.

parameters.name: otoco_config
parameters.description: List of trades to create or cancel when this order is filled.

get.description: Set config for MMP - triggers MMP reset **Max Quote Quantity (MQQ):** The `max_quote_quantity` parameter determines the total combined size of open MMP orders per side, per order book, that cannot be exceeded (measured in base currency). **Important Notes:** - **MQQ limits cumulative size, not order count:** For example, with MQQ of 3 BTC, you can place multiple orders (three orders of 1 BTC each, or one order of 2.5 BTC plus one of 0.5 BTC) as long as the total size per side per instrument does not exceed 3 BTC - **Base currency:** MQQ is specified and enforced in base currency - **Inverse futures:** Size is calculated as Amount / Price to convert to base currency - **Inverse future spreads:** Size is calculated as Amount / IndexPrice - **SM accounts:** MMP orders and quotes on options and option_combos are not supported for SM accounts - **Rejections:** Individual quotes and MMP orders above `max_quote_quantity` are rejected - **Precision:** All MMP configuration values support maximum 4 decimal places - **Current margin calculation:** Currently, `quantity_limit` is used for margin calculation (will switch to `max_quote_quantity` in December 2025) **Coming in December 2025 Release:** - **Margin calculation:** Will switch completely from `quantity_limit` to `max_quote_quantity` (3% of MQQ) - **Inverse future spreads:** Size calculation will switch from IndexPrice to minimum mark price of legs - **Quote rejection:** If one side of a quote is rejected, the other side will also be rejected **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Market Maker Protection API Configuration](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/27308287203357-Market-Maker-Protection-API-Configuration)

parameters.name: index_name
parameters.description: Index identifier of derivative instrument on the platform

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: MMP Interval in seconds, if set to 0 MMP is removed

parameters.name: frozen_time
parameters.description: MMP frozen time in seconds, if set to 0 manual reset is required

parameters.name: mmp_group
parameters.description: Designates the MMP group for which the configuration is being set. If the specified group is already associated with a different `index_name`, an error is returned. This parameter enables distinct configurations for each MMP group, linked to particular `index_name`. Maximum 64 characters. Case sensitive. Cannot be empty string. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Mass Quotes Specifications](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/26302715576989-Mass-Quotes-Specifications)

parameters.name: quantity_limit
parameters.description: Quantity limit used as MMP trigger threshold. When the total size (measured in base currency) per underlying within the exposure time interval meets or exceeds this value, MMP is triggered and quotes are automatically removed. Positive value with maximum 4 decimal places.

parameters.name: delta_limit
parameters.description: Delta limit used as MMP trigger threshold. When the delta value per underlying within the exposure time interval meets or exceeds this value, MMP is triggered and quotes are automatically removed. Positive value with maximum 4 decimal places.

parameters.name: vega_limit
parameters.description: Vega limit used as MMP trigger threshold. When the vega value per underlying within the exposure time interval meets or exceeds this value, MMP is triggered and quotes are automatically removed. Positive value with maximum 4 decimal places.

parameters.name: max_quote_quantity
parameters.description: Maximum Quote Quantity (MQQ) determines the total combined size of open MMP orders per side, per order book, that cannot be exceeded. **Key Points:** - MQQ is specified in **base currency** and limits cumulative order **size**, not the number of orders - Example: With MQQ of 3 BTC, you can place three orders of 1 BTC each, or one order of 2.5 BTC plus one of 0.5 BTC, etc. - For **inverse futures**: size is calculated as `Amount / Price` - For **inverse future spreads**: size is calculated as `Amount / IndexPrice` - Individual MMP orders and quotes above Max Quote Quantity are **rejected** - Positive value with **maximum 4 decimal places** **Note:** Starting December 2025 release: 1. MQQ will also be used for **Initial Margin calculation** (3% of MQQ will be taken as Initial Margin for MMP orders and quotes; currently `quantity_limit` is used for margin) 2. For inverse future spreads, size calculation will switch from `IndexPrice` to **minimum mark price of legs**

parameters.name: block_rfq
parameters.description: If true, configures MMP for Block RFQ. When set, requires block_rfq scope instead of trade scope. Block RFQ MMP settings are completely separate from normal order/quote MMP settings.

parameters.name: trade_count_limit
parameters.description: For Block RFQ only (`block_rfq` = `true`). Sets the maximum number of Block RFQ trades allowed in the lookback window. Each RFQ trade counts as `+1` towards the limit (not individual legs). Works across all currency pairs. When using this parameter, `index_name` must be set to `"all"`. Maximum - `1000`.

get.description: Reset Market Maker Protection (MMP) limits for the specified currency pair or group. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Market Maker Protection API Configuration](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/27308287203357-Market-Maker-Protection-API-Configuration)

parameters.name: index_name
parameters.description: Currency pair for which to reset MMP limits. **For regular MMP (`block_rfq = false`):** Must be a specific currency pair (e.g., "btc_usd", "eth_usd"). The value `"all"` is not allowed. **For Block RFQ MMP (`block_rfq = true`):** Can be either a specific currency pair or `"all"` to reset MMP limits across all currency pairs.

parameters.name: mmp_group
parameters.description: Specifies the MMP group for which limits are being reset. If this parameter is omitted, the method resets the traditional (no group) MMP limits. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Mass Quotes Specifications](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/26302715576989-Mass-Quotes-Specifications)

parameters.name: block_rfq
parameters.description: If true, resets MMP for Block RFQ. When set, requires `block_rfq` scope instead of `trade` scope. Block RFQ MMP settings are completely separate from normal order/quote MMP settings. When `block_rfq = true`, the `index_name` parameter can be set to `"all"` to reset limits across all currency pairs.

parameters.name: wait_for_response

parameters.name: detailed

parameters.name: mmp_group

parameters.name: valid_until
parameters.description: Timestamp, when provided server will start processing request in Matching Engine only before given timestamp, in other cases `timed_out` error will be responded. Remember that the given timestamp should be consistent with the server's time, use [/public/time](#public-get_time) method to obtain current server time.

When editing an option order with advanced=implv, the field price should be a value of implied volatility in percentages. For example, price=100, means implied volatility of 100%

order_price.name: price
order_price.description: The order price in base currency (Only for limit and stop_limit orders) When adding an order with advanced=usd, the field price should be the option price value in USD. When adding an order with advanced=implv, the field price should be a value of implied volatility in percentages. For example, price=100, means implied volatility of 100%

linked_order_type.name: linked_order_type
linked_order_type.description: The type of the linked order. - `"one_triggers_other"` - Execution of primary order triggers the placement of one or more secondary orders. - `"one_cancels_other"` - The execution of one order in a pair automatically cancels the other, typically used to set a stop-loss and take-profit simultaneously. - `"one_triggers_one_cancels_other"` - The execution of a primary order triggers two secondary orders (a stop-loss and take-profit pair), where the execution of one secondary order cancels the other.

otoco_config.name: otoco_config
otoco_config.description: List of trades to create or cancel when this order is filled.

trigger_fill_condition.name: trigger_fill_condition
trigger_fill_condition.description: The fill condition of the linked order (Only for linked order types), default: `first_hit`. - `"first_hit"` - any execution of the primary order will fully cancel/place all secondary orders. - `"complete_fill"` - a complete execution (meaning the primary order no longer exists) will cancel/place the secondary orders. - `"incremental"` - any fill of the primary order will cause proportional partial cancellation/placement of the secondary order. The amount that will be subtracted/added to the secondary order will be rounded down to the contract size.

time_in_force.name: time_in_force
time_in_force.description: Specifies how long the order remains in effect. Default `"good_til_cancelled"` - `"good_til_cancelled"` - unfilled order remains in order book until cancelled - `"good_til_day"` - unfilled order remains in order book till the end of the trading session - `"fill_or_kill"` - execute a transaction immediately and completely or not at all - `"immediate_or_cancel"` - execute a transaction immediately, and any portion of the order that cannot be immediately filled is cancelled

length_for_perpetual_chart.name: length
length_for_perpetual_chart.description: Specifies time period. `8h` - 8 hours, `24h` - 24 hours, `1m` - 1 month

max_show.name: max_show
max_show.description: Deprecated. Maximum amount within an order to be shown to other customers, `0` for invisible order

display_amount.name: display_amount
display_amount.description: Initial display amount for iceberg order. Has to be at least 100 times minimum amount for instrument and ratio of hidden part vs visible part has to be less than 100 as well.

post_only_buy.name: post_only
post_only_buy.description: If true, the order is considered post-only. If the new price would cause the order to be filled immediately (as taker), the price will be changed to be just below the spread. Only valid in combination with time_in_force=`"good_til_cancelled"`

post_only_sell.name: post_only
post_only_sell.description: If true, the order is considered post-only. If the new price would cause the order to be filled immediately (as taker), the price will be changed to be just above the spread. Only valid in combination with time_in_force=`"good_til_cancelled"`

post_only_edit.name: post_only
post_only_edit.description: If true, the order is considered post-only. If the new price would cause the order to be filled immediately (as taker), the price will be changed to be just below or above the spread (accordingly to the original order type). Only valid in combination with time_in_force=`"good_til_cancelled"`

post_only_secondary.name: post_only
post_only_secondary.description: If true, the order is considered post-only. If the new price would cause the order to be filled immediately (as taker), the price will be changed to be just below or above the spread (according to the direction of the order). Only valid in combination with time_in_force=`"good_til_cancelled"`

reject_post_only.name: reject_post_only
reject_post_only.description: If an order is considered post-only and this field is set to true then the order is put to the order book unmodified or the request is rejected. Only valid in combination with `"post_only"` set to true

optional_default.name: default
optional_default.description: If `true`, new key is marked as default

reduce_only.name: reduce_only
reduce_only.description: If `true`, the order is considered reduce-only which is intended to only reduce a current position

trigger_price.name: trigger_price
trigger_price.description: Trigger price, required for trigger orders only (Stop-loss or Take-profit orders)

trigger_offset.name: trigger_offset
trigger_offset.description: The maximum deviation from the price peak beyond which the order will be triggered

mmp.name: mmp
mmp.description: Order MMP flag, only for order_type 'limit'

valid_until.name: valid_until
valid_until.description: Timestamp, when provided server will start processing request in Matching Engine only before given timestamp, in other cases `timed_out` error will be responded. Remember that the given timestamp should be consistent with the server's time, use [/public/time](#public-get_time) method to obtain current server time.

trigger.name: trigger
trigger.description: Defines the trigger type. Required for `"Stop-Loss"`, `"Take-Profit"` and `"Trailing"` trigger orders

advanced_order_type.name: advanced
advanced_order_type.description: Advanced option order type. (Only for options. Advanced USD orders are not supported for linear options.)

edit_advanced_order_type.name: advanced
edit_advanced_order_type.description: Advanced option order type. If you have posted an advanced option order, it is necessary to re-supply this parameter when editing it (Only for options)

currency_address_from_address_book.name: address
currency_address_from_address_book.description: Address in currency format, it must be in address book

transfer_currency_amount.name: amount
transfer_currency_amount.description: Amount of funds to be transferred

withdrawal_currency_amount.name: amount
withdrawal_currency_amount.description: Amount of funds to be withdrawn

withdrawal_priority.name: priority
withdrawal_priority.description: Withdrawal priority, optional for BTC, default: `high`

address_label.name: label
address_label.description: Label of the address book entry

beneficiary_first_name.name: beneficiary_first_name
beneficiary_first_name.description: First name of beneficiary (if beneficiary is a person)

beneficiary_last_name.name: beneficiary_last_name
beneficiary_last_name.description: First name of beneficiary (if beneficiary is a person)

beneficiary_company_name.name: beneficiary_company_name
beneficiary_company_name.description: Beneficiary company name (if beneficiary is a company)

beneficiary_vasp_website.name: beneficiary_vasp_website
beneficiary_vasp_website.description: Website of the beneficiary VASP. Required if the address book entry is associated with a VASP that is not included in the list of known VASPs

agree_to_share_with_3rd_party.name: agreed
agree_to_share_with_3rd_party.description: Indicates that the user agreed to shared provided information with 3rd parties

personal_wallet.name: personal
personal_wallet.description: The user confirms that he provided address belongs to him and he has access to it via an un-hosted wallet software

extra_currencies.name: extra_currencies
extra_currencies.description: The user can pass a list of currencies to add the address for. It is currently available ONLY for ERC20 currencies. Without passing this paramater for an ERC20 currency, the address will be added to ALL of the ERC20 currencies.

transfer_destination_for_user.name: destination
transfer_destination_for_user.description: Destination wallet's address taken from address book

transfer_destination_for_subaccount.name: destination
transfer_destination_for_subaccount.description: Id of destination subaccount. Can be found in `My Account >> Subaccounts` tab

transfer_source_for_subaccount.name: source
transfer_source_for_subaccount.description: Id of the source (sub)account. Can be found in `My Account >> Subaccounts` tab. By default, it is the Id of the account which made the request. However, if a different "source" is specified, the user must possess the mainaccount scope, and only other subaccounts can be designated as the source.

optional_user_id.name: user_id
optional_user_id.description: Id of a (sub)account - by default current user id is used

trade_allocation_user_id.name: user_id
trade_allocation_user_id.description: User ID (subaccount or main account) to allocate part of the RFQ amount.

trade_allocation_client_id.name: client_id
trade_allocation_client_id.description: ID of a client; available to broker. Represents a group of users under a common name.

trade_allocation_client_link_id.name: client_link_id
trade_allocation_client_link_id.description: ID assigned to a single user in a client; available to broker.

trade_allocation_amount.name: amount
trade_allocation_amount.description: Amount allocated to this user or client.

pme_enabled.name: enabled
pme_enabled.description: Whether PM or SM should be enabled - PM while `true`, SM otherwise

dry_run.name: dry_run
dry_run.description: If `true` request returns the result without switching the margining model. Default: `false`

position_move_source_uid.name: source_uid
position_move_source_uid.description: Id of source subaccount. Can be found in `My Account >> Subaccounts` tab

position_move_target_uid.name: target_uid
position_move_target_uid.description: Id of target subaccount. Can be found in `My Account >> Subaccounts` tab

tfa.name: tfa
tfa.description: TFA code, required when TFA is enabled for current account

chart_resolution.name: resolution
chart_resolution.description: Chart bars resolution given in full minutes or keyword `1D` (only some specific resolutions are supported)

vix_resolution.name: resolution
vix_resolution.description: Time resolution given in full seconds or keyword `1D` (only some specific resolutions are supported)

key_name.name: name
key_name.description: Name of key (only letters, numbers and underscores allowed; maximum length - 16 characters)

key_name_required.name: name
key_name_required.description: Name of key (only letters, numbers and underscores allowed; maximum length - 16 characters)

key_scope.name: max_scope
key_scope.description: Describes maximal access for tokens generated with given key, possible values: `trade:[read, read_write, none]`, `wallet:[read, read_write, none]`, `account:[read, read_write, none]`, `block_trade:[read, read_write, none]`. If scope is not provided, its value is set as none. Please check details described in [Access scope](#access-scope)

key_features.name: enabled_features
key_features.description: List of enabled advanced on-key features. Available options: - `restricted_block_trades`: Limit the block_trade read the scope of the API key to block trades that have been made using this specific API key - `block_trade_approval`: Block trades created using this API key require additional user approval. Methods that use `block_rfq` scope are not affected by Block Trade approval feature

enable_key.name: enabled
enable_key.description: Enables/disables the API key. `true` to enable, `false` to disable

whitelist_ip.name: ip_whitelist
whitelist_ip.description: Whitelist provided IP address on a selected key

public_key.name: public_key
public_key.description: ED25519 or RSA PEM Encoded public key that should be used to create asymmetric API Key for signing requests/authentication requests with user's private key. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Asymmetric API keys](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25944616699165-Asymmetric-API-keys)

optional_query.name: query
optional_query.description: The following keywords can be used to filter the results: `trade`, `maker`, `taker`, `open`, `close`, `liquidation`, `buy`, `sell`, `withdrawal`, `delivery`, `settlement`, `deposit`, `transfer`, `option`, `future`, `correction`, `block_trade`, `swap`. Plus withdrawal or transfer addresses

cod_scope.name: scope
cod_scope.description: Specifies if Cancel On Disconnect change should be applied/checked for the current connection or the account (default - `connection`) **NOTICE:** Scope `connection` can be used only when working via Websocket.

range.name: range
range.description: Range of the data to return

extended_volume_statistics.name: extended
extended_volume_statistics.description: Request for extended statistics. Including also 7 and 30 days volumes (default false)

security_key_name.name: name
security_key_name.description: Name of security key, only alpha numeric chars allowed with - and _

invalidate_token.name: invalidate_token
invalidate_token.description: If value is `true` all tokens created in current session are invalidated, default: `true`

self_trading_mode.name: mode
self_trading_mode.description: Self trading prevention behavior: `reject_taker` (reject the incoming order), `cancel_maker` (cancel the matched order in the book)

extended_to_subaccounts.name: extended_to_subaccounts
extended_to_subaccounts.description: If value is `true` trading is prevented between subaccounts of given account, otherwise they are treated separately

block_rfq_self_match_prevention.name: block_rfq_self_match_prevention
block_rfq_self_match_prevention.description: When Block RFQ Self Match Prevention is enabled, it ensures that RFQs cannot be executed between accounts that belong to the same legal entity. This setting is independent of the general self-match prevention settings and must be configured separately.

balance.name: balance
balance.description: Current custody balance of the user

difference.name: difference
difference.description: Difference between current "in exchange" balance and current custody balance that happened due to the settlement.

external_id.name: external_id
external_id.description: User ID in the external system. (i.e. in custodian system)

business_registration_number.name: business_registration_number
business_registration_number.description: The registration number of the company

trading_products.name: trading_products
trading_products.description: List of available trading products. Available products: perpetual, futures, options, future_combos, option_combos, spots

withdrawal_policy_amount.name: amount
withdrawal_policy_amount.description: Amount or flag to use default value

simulated_positions_map.name: simulated_positions
simulated_positions_map.description: Object with positions in following form: `{InstrumentName1: Position1, InstrumentName2: Position2...}`, for example `{"BTC-PERPETUAL": -1000.0}` (or corresponding URI-encoding for GET). For futures in USD, for options in base currency.

simulated_positions_map_base.name: simulated_positions
simulated_positions_map_base.description: Object with positions in following form: `{InstrumentName1: Position1, InstrumentName2: Position2...}`, for example `{"BTC-PERPETUAL": -1.0}` (or corresponding URI-encoding for GET). Size in base currency.

add_positions.name: add_positions
add_positions.description: If `true`, adds simulated positions to current positions, otherwise uses only simulated positions. By default `true`

block_rfq_label.name: label
block_rfq_label.description: User defined label for the Block RFQ (maximum 64 characters)

block_rfq_amount.description: This value multiplied by the ratio of a leg gives trade size on that leg.
block_rfq_amount.name: amount

block_rfq_legs.description: List of legs used to create Block RFQ
block_rfq_legs.name: legs

block_rfq_hedge_leg.description: Hedge leg of the Block RFQ. There is only one hedge leg allowed per Block RFQ
block_rfq_hedge_leg.name: hedge

block_rfq_trade_legs.description: List of legs used to trade Block RFQ
block_rfq_trade_legs.name: legs

block_rfq_legs_quote.description: List of legs used for Block RFQ quote
block_rfq_legs_quote.name: legs

block_rfq_hedge_leg_quote.description: Hedge leg of the Block RFQ. There is only one hedge leg allowed per Block RFQ
block_rfq_hedge_leg_quote.name: hedge

block_rfq_hedge_leg_trade.description: Hedge leg of the Block RFQ. There is only one hedge leg allowed per Block RFQ
block_rfq_hedge_leg_trade.name: hedge

block_rfq_quote_id.name: block_rfq_quote_id
block_rfq_quote_id.description: ID of the Block RFQ quote

block_rfq_quote_label.name: label
block_rfq_quote_label.description: User defined label for the Block RFQ quote (maximum 64 characters). Used to identify quotes of a selected Block RFQ

block_rfq_makers.name: makers
block_rfq_makers.description: List of targeted Block RFQ makers. Only those makers will be notified about created Block RFQ. If the list is empty, all available makers will be targeted.

execution_instruction.name: execution_instruction
execution_instruction.description: Execution instruction of the quote. Default - `any_part_of` - `"all_or_none (AON)"` - The quote can only be filled entirely or not at all, ensuring that its amount matches the amount specified in the Block RFQ. Additionally, 'all_or_none' quotes have priority over 'any_part_of' quotes at the same price level. - `"any_part_of (APO)"` - The quote can be filled either partially or fully, with the filled amount potentially being less than the Block RFQ amount.

block_rfq_count.name: count
block_rfq_count.description: Count of Block RFQs returned, maximum - `1000`

block_trade_count.name: count
block_trade_count.description: Count of Block Trades returned, maximum - `101`

transaction_log_count.name: count
transaction_log_count.description: Count of transaction log entries returned, default - `100`, maximum - `250`

block_rfq_continuation.name: continuation
block_rfq_continuation.description: The continuation parameter specifies the starting point for fetching historical Block RFQs. When provided, the endpoint returns Block RFQs, starting from the specified ID and continuing backward (e.g., if `continuation` is 50, results will include Block RFQs of ID 49, 48, etc.)

block_rfq_string_continuation.name: continuation
block_rfq_string_continuation.description: Continuation token for pagination. Consists of `timestamp` and `block_rfq_id`.

block_rfq_role.name: role
block_rfq_role.description: Role of the user in Block RFQ. When the `any` role is selected, the method returns all Block RFQs in which the user has participated, either as the `taker` or as a `maker`

block_rfq_taker_direction.description: Direction of the trade from the taker perspective
block_rfq_taker_direction.name: direction

block_rfq_leg_direction.description: Direction of selected leg. Must match the direction of the corresponding leg in the Block RFQ
block_rfq_leg_direction.name: direction

legs_for_prices.description: List of legs for which the prices will be calculated
legs_for_prices.name: legs

legs_price.name: price
legs_price.description: Price for the whole leg structure

originator.description: Information about the originator of the deposit
originator.name: originator

tx_hash.name: tx_hash
tx_hash.description: Transaction id in a proper format for the currency

is_personal.name: is_personal
is_personal.description: If the user is the originator of the deposit

company_name.name: company_name
company_name.description: Company name of the originator if the originator is a legal entity

first_name.name: first_name
first_name.description: If the user is the originator of the deposit

last_name.name: last_name
last_name.description: Last name of the originator if the originator is a person

historical.name: historical
historical.description: Determines whether historical trade and order records should be retrieved. - `false` (default): Returns recent records: orders for 30 min, trades for 24h. - `true`: Fetches historical records, available after a short delay due to indexing. Recent data is not included. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Accessing historical trades and orders using API](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25973087226909-Accessing-historical-trades-and-orders-using-API)

with_continuation.name: with_continuation
with_continuation.description: When set to true, the API response format changes from a simple list of orders to an object containing the orders and a continuation token.

disclosed.name: disclosed
disclosed.description: Determines whether the RFQ is non-anonymous, revealing both taker and maker aliases. It can be set to `false` (anonymous mode) only when at least 5 makers are targeted. Default value is `true`.

custody_settlement_review_reason.name: reason
custody_settlement_review_reason.description: Optional reason provided for ignoring or rejecting the instruction

custody_settlement_review.description: List of review instructions for each currency
custody_settlement_review.name: currencies

expected_custody_balance.description: Expected custody balance of the user
expected_custody_balance.name: expected_custody_balance

custody_balance.description: Balance of the user in the custodian system.
custody_balance.name: custody_balance

custody_settlement_initiate.description: Request settlement for the given currencies
custody_settlement_initiate.name: currencies

custody_currency.name: currency
custody_currency.description: The currency supported by custodian and exchange

expires_at.name: expires_at
expires_at.description: The timestamp when the quote expires (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

unhosted_wallet.name: unhosted
unhosted_wallet.description: Indicates if the address belongs to an unhosted wallet

limit_optional.name: limit
limit_optional.description: Maximum number of results to return

trade_allocations.name: trade_allocations
trade_allocations.description: List of allocations for Block RFQ pre-allocation. Allows to split amount between different (sub)accounts or broker clients. Each allocation must specify either `user_id` (for direct allocation) or `client_info` object (for broker allocation), and amount.

pending_withdrawal_balance.description: Pending balance transferred from trading account to custody account

auto_deposit.description: When set to 'true' all new funds added to custody balance will be automatically transferred to trading balance

client_id.description: API key 'client id' used to reserve/release funds in custody platform, requires scope 'custody:read_write'

withdrawal_address.description: Address that is used for withdrawals

withdrawal_address_change.description: UNIX timestamp after when new withdrawal address will be used for withdrawals

pending_withdrawal_addres.description: New withdrawal address that will be used after 'withdrawal_address_change'

deposit_address.description: Address that can be used for deposits

success.description: When request was successful set to `true`

low.description: Price of the 24h lowest trade, `null` if there weren't any trades

volume.description: The total 24h traded volume (in base currency)

bid_price.description: The current best bid price, `null` if there aren't any bids

ask_price.description: The current best ask price, `null` if there aren't any asks

mid_price.description: The average of the best bid and ask, `null` if there aren't any asks or bids

last.description: The price of the latest trade, `null` if there weren't any trades

open_interest.description: Optional (only for derivatives). The total amount of outstanding contracts in the corresponding amount units. For perpetual and inverse futures the amount is in USD units. For options and linear futures and it is the underlying base currency coin.

estimated_delivery_price.description: Optional (only for derivatives). Estimated delivery price for the market. For more details, see Contract Specification > General Documentation > Expiration Price.

volume_notional.description: Volume in quote currency (futures and spots only)

interest_rate.description: Interest rate used in implied volatility calculations (options only)

underlying_index.description: Name of the underlying future, or `'index_price'` (options only)

underlying_price.description: underlying price for implied volatility calculations (options only)

price_change.description: 24-hour price change expressed as a percentage, `null` if there weren't any trades

average_price.description: Average price of trades that built this position

mark_price.description: Current mark price for position's instrument

settlement_price.description: Optional (not added for spot). Last settlement price for position's instrument 0 if instrument wasn't settled yet

size.description: Position size for futures size in quote currency (e.g. USD), for options size is in base currency (e.g. BTC)

size_currency.description: Only for futures, position size in base currency

average_price_usd.description: Only for options, average price in USD

floating_profit_loss_usd.description: Only for options, floating profit or loss in USD

leverage.description: Current available leverage for future position

realized_funding.description: Realized Funding in current session included in session realized profit or loss, only for positions of perpetual instruments

estimated_liquidation_price.description: Estimated liquidation price, added only for futures, for users with `segregated_sm` margin model

confirmed_timestamp.description: The timestamp (milliseconds since the Unix epoch) of withdrawal confirmation, `null` when not confirmed

id.description: Withdrawal id in Deribit system

calls_volume.description: Total 24h trade volume for call options.

puts_volume.description: Total 24h trade volume for put options.

calls_volume_7d.description: Total 7d trade volume for call options.

puts_volume_7d.description: Total 7d trade volume for put options.

calls_volume_30d.description: Total 30d trade volume for call options.

puts_volume_30d.description: Total 30d trade volume for put options.

ip_whitelist.description: List of IP addresses whitelisted for a selected key

ip.description: IP address of source that generated action

country.description: Country where the IP address is registered (estimated)

city.description: City where the IP address is registered (estimated)

log.description: Action description, values: `changed_email` - email was changed; `changed_password` - password was changed; `disabled_tfa` - TFA was disabled; `enabled_tfa` - TFA was enabled, `success` - successful login; `failure` - login failure; `enabled_subaccount_login` - login was enabled for subaccount (in `data` - subaccount uid); `disabled_subaccount_login` - login was disabled for subbaccount (in `data` - subbacount uid);`new_api_key` - API key was created (in `data` key client id); `removed_api_key` - API key was removed (in `data` key client id); `changed_scope` - scope of API key was changed (in `data` key client id); `changed_whitelist` - whitelist of API key was edited (in `data` key client id); `disabled_api_key` - API key was disabled (in `data` key client id); `enabled_api_key` - API key was enabled (in `data` key client id); `reset_api_key` - API key was reset (in `data` key client id)

data.description: Optional, additional information about action, type depends on `log` value

is_rebalance.description: Optional (only for spot). `true` if order was automatically created during cross-collateral balance restoration

is_liquidation.description: Optional (not added for spot). `true` if order was automatically created during liquidation

mmp.description: `true` if the order is a MMP order, otherwise `false`.

risk_reducing.description: `true` if the order is marked by the platform as a risk reducing order (can apply only to orders placed by PM users), otherwise `false`.

replaced.description: `true` if the order was edited (by user or - in case of advanced options orders - by pricing engine), otherwise `false`.

auto_replaced.description: Options, advanced orders only - `true` if last modification of the order was performed by the pricing engine, otherwise `false`.

quote.description: If order is a quote. Present only if true.

mmp_group.description: Name of the MMP group supplied in the `private/mass_quote` request. Only present for quote orders.

quote_set_id.description: Identifier of the QuoteSet supplied in the `private/mass_quote` request. Only present for quote orders.

quote_id.description: The same QuoteID as supplied in the `private/mass_quote` request. Only present for quote orders.

trigger_order_id.description: Id of the trigger order that created the order (Only for orders that were created by triggered orders).

app_name.description: The name of the application that placed the order on behalf of the user (optional).

mmp_cancelled.description: `true` if order was cancelled by mmp trigger (optional)

oto_order_ids.description: The Ids of the orders that will be triggered if the order is filled

primary_order_id.description: ID of the order that triggered this order.

is_primary_otoco.description: `true` if the order is an order that can trigger an OCO pair, otherwise not present.

price_index.description: Name of price index that is used for this instrument

trigger_order_id.description: Id of the user order used for the trigger-order reference before triggering

request.description: Type of last request performed on the trigger order by user or system. `"cancel"` - when order was cancelled, `"trigger:order"` - when trigger order spawned market or limit order after being triggered

source.description: Source of the order that is linked to the trigger order.

funding.description: funding (in base currency ; settlement for perpetual product only)

index_price.description: underlying index price at time of event (in quote currency; settlement and delivery only)

mark_price.description: mark price for at the settlement time (in quote currency; settlement and delivery only)

position.description: position size (in quote currency; settlement and delivery only)

profit_loss.description: profit and loss (in base currency; settlement and delivery only)

session_bankruptcy.description: value of session bankruptcy (in base currency; bankruptcy only)

session_profit_loss.description: total value of session profit and losses (in base currency)

session_tax.description: total amount of paid taxes/fees (in base currency; bankruptcy only)

session_tax_rate.description: rate of paid taxes/fees (in base currency; bankruptcy only)

socialized.description: the amount of the socialized losses (in base currency; bankruptcy only)

index_price.description: Index Price at the moment of trade

amount.description: Trade amount. For perpetual and inverse futures the amount is in USD units. For options and linear futures and it is the underlying base currency coin.

contracts.description: Trade size in contract units (optional, may be absent in historical trades)

iv.description: Option implied volatility for the price (Option only)

liquidation.description: Optional field (only for trades caused by liquidation): `"M"` when maker side of trade was under liquidation, `"T"` when taker side was under liquidation, `"MT"` when both sides of trade were under liquidation

mark_price.description: Mark Price at the moment of trade

combo_id.description: Optional field containing combo instrument name if the trade is a combo trade

combo_trade_id.description: Optional field containing combo trade identifier if the trade is a combo trade

block_rfq_id.description: ID of the Block RFQ - when trade was part of the Block RFQ

advanced.description: Advanced type of user order: `"usd"` or `"implv"` (only for options; omitted if not applicable)

order_id.description: Id of the user order (maker or taker), i.e. subscriber's order id that took part in the trade

index_price.description: Index Price at the moment of trade

amount.description: Trade amount. For perpetual and inverse futures the amount is in USD units. For options and linear futures and it is the underlying base currency coin.

contracts.description: Trade size in contract units (optional, may be absent in historical trades)

iv.description: Option implied volatility for the price (Option only)

underlying_price.description: Underlying price for implied volatility calculations (Options only)

liquidation.description: Optional field (only for trades caused by liquidation): `"M"` when maker side of trade was under liquidation, `"T"` when taker side was under liquidation, `"MT"` when both sides of trade were under liquidation

liquidity.description: Describes what was role of users order: `"M"` when it was maker order, `"T"` when it was taker order

fee.description: User's fee in units of the specified `fee_currency`

block_rfq_id.description: ID of the Block RFQ - when trade was part of the Block RFQ

block_rfq_quote_id.description: ID of the Block RFQ quote - when trade was part of the Block RFQ

risk_reducing.description: `true` if user order is marked by the platform as a risk reducing order (can apply only to orders placed by PM users)

api.description: `true` if user order was created with API

mark_price.description: Mark Price at the moment of trade

legs.description: Optional field containing leg trades if trade is a combo trade (present when querying for **only** combo trades and in `combo_trades` events)

combo_id.description: Optional field containing combo instrument name if the trade is a combo trade

combo_trade_id.description: Optional field containing combo trade identifier if the trade is a combo trade

quote_set_id.description: QuoteSet of the user order (optional, present only for orders placed with `private/mass_quote`)

quote_id.description: QuoteID of the user order (optional, present only for orders placed with `private/mass_quote`)

trade_allocations.description: List of allocations for Block RFQ pre-allocation. Each allocation specifies `user_id`, `amount`, and `fee` for the allocated part of the trade. For broker client allocations, a `client_info` object will be included.

user_id.description: User ID to which part of the trade is allocated. For brokers the User ID is obstructed.

amount.description: Amount allocated to this user.

fee.description: Fee for the allocated part of the trade.

client_info.description: Optional client allocation info for brokers.

client_id.description: ID of a client; available to broker. Represents a group of users under a common name.

client_link_id.description: ID assigned to a single user in a client; available to broker.

name.description: Name of the linked user within the client; available to broker.

nonce.description: Nonce that can be used to approve or reject pending block trade.

timestamp.description: Timestamp that can be used to approve or reject pending block trade.

app_name.description: The name of the application that executed the block trade on behalf of the user (optional).

username.description: Username of the user who initiated the block trade.

broker_code.description: Broker code associated with the broker block trade.

broker_name.description: Name of the broker associated with the block trade.

state.description: State of the pending block trade for current user.

counterparty_state.description: State of the pending block trade for the other party (optional).

amount.description: Trade amount. For perpetual and inverse futures the amount is in USD units. For options and linear futures and it is the underlying base currency coin.

settlement_currency.description: Optional (not added for spot). Settlement currency for the instrument.

quote_currency.description: The currency in which the instrument prices are quoted.

min_trade_amount.description: Minimum amount for trading. For perpetual and inverse futures the amount is in USD units. For options and linear futures and it is the underlying base currency coin.

is_active.description: Indicates if the instrument can currently be traded.

settlement_period.description: Optional (not added for spot). The settlement period.

creation_timestamp.description: The time when the instrument was first created (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch).

tick_size.description: Specifies minimal price change and, as follows, the number of decimal places for instrument prices.

expiration_timestamp.description: The time when the instrument will expire (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch).

future_type.description: Future type (only for futures)(field is deprecated and will be removed in the future, `instrument_type` should be used instead).

max_liquidation_commission.description: Maximal liquidation trade commission for instrument (only for futures).

block_trade_tick_size.description: Specifies minimal price change for block trading.

max_leverage.description: Maximal leverage for instrument (only for futures).

withdrawal_fee.description: The total transaction fee paid for withdrawals

min_withdrawal_fee.description: The minimum transaction fee paid for withdrawals

currency.description: The abbreviation of the currency. This abbreviation is used elsewhere in the API to identify the currency.

currency_long.description: The full name for the currency.

min_confirmations.description: Minimum number of block chain confirmations before deposit is accepted.

in_cross_collateral_pool.description: `true` if the currency is part of the cross collateral pool

apr.description: Simple Moving Average (SMA) of the last 7 days of rewards. If fewer than 7 days of reward data are available, the APR is calculated as the average of the available rewards. Only applicable to yield-generating tokens (`USDE`, `STETH`, `USDC`, `BUILD`).

decimals.description: The number of decimal places for the currency

app_name.description: The name of the application that executed the block trade on behalf of the user (optional).

broker_code.description: Broker code associated with the broker block trade.

broker_name.description: Name of the broker associated with the block trade.

cashflow.description: For futures and perpetual contracts: Realized session PNL (since last settlement). For options: the amount paid or received for the options traded.

change.description: Change in cash balance. For trades: fees and options premium paid/received. For settlement: Futures session PNL and perpetual session funding.

info.description: Additional information regarding transaction. Strongly dependent on the log entry type

equity.description: Updated equity value after the transaction

settlement_price.description: The settlement price for the instrument during the delivery

index_price.description: The index price for the instrument during the delivery

position.description: Updated position size after the transaction

side.description: One of: `short` or `long` in case of settlements, `close sell` or `close buy` in case of deliveries, `open sell`, `open buy`, `close sell`, `close buy` in case of trades

price.description: Settlement/delivery price or the price level of the traded contracts

price_currency.description: Currency symbol associated with the `price` field value

profit_as_cashflow.description: Indicator informing whether the cashflow is waiting for settlement or not

interest_pl.description: Actual funding rate of trades and settlements on perpetual instruments

ip.description: The IP address from which the trade was initiated

pnl.description: Profit net loss of the user (total_equity - custody)

interval.description: MMP Interval in seconds, if set to 0 MMP is disabled

frozen_time.description: MMP frozen time in seconds, if set to 0 manual reset is required

quantity_limit.description: Quantity limit used as MMP trigger threshold. When the total size (measured in base currency) per underlying within the exposure time interval meets or exceeds this value, MMP is triggered. Maximum 4 decimal places.

delta_limit.description: Delta limit used as MMP trigger threshold. When the delta value per underlying within the exposure time interval meets or exceeds this value, MMP is triggered. Maximum 4 decimal places.

vega_limit.description: Vega limit used as MMP trigger threshold. When the vega value per underlying within the exposure time interval meets or exceeds this value, MMP is triggered. Maximum 4 decimal places.

max_quote_quantity.description: Maximum Quote Quantity (MQQ). The total combined size of open MMP orders per side, per order book, cannot exceed MQQ (specified in base currency). MQQ limits cumulative order size, not the number of orders. For inverse futures, size is calculated as Amount / Price. For inverse future spreads, size is calculated as Amount / IndexPrice. Individual MMP orders and quotes above Max Quote Quantity are rejected. Maximum 4 decimal places. Starting December 2025 release - (1) MQQ will also be used for Initial Margin calculation (3% of MQQ will be taken as Initial Margin for MMP orders and quotes; currently quantity_limit is used for margin), and (2) for inverse future spreads, size calculation will switch from IndexPrice to minimum mark price of legs.

block_rfq.description: If true, indicates MMP configuration for Block RFQ. Block RFQ MMP settings are completely separate from normal order/quote MMP settings.

trade_count_limit.description: For Block RFQ only. The maximum number of Block RFQ trades allowed in the lookback window. Each RFQ trade counts as +1 towards the limit (not individual legs). Works across all currency pairs.

frozen_until.description: Timestamp (milliseconds since the UNIX epoch) until the user will be frozen - 0 means that the user is frozen until manual reset.

signature_payload.description: Serialized JSON string of the result (without the `signature` and `signature_payload` fields). The JSON string is compressed using Gzip and encoded in Base64. To validate the process, the user should first decode the Base64-encoded `signature_payload` and then un-Gzip the decoded payload to retrieve the original JSON string. Next, the user should verify the `signature` by using the decoded JSON string along with the corresponding public key, ensuring that the signature was correctly generated.

amount.description: It represents the requested order size. For perpetual and inverse futures the amount is in USD units. For options and linear futures and it is the underlying base currency coin.

advanced.description: advanced type: `"usd"` or `"implv"` (Only for options; field is omitted if not applicable).

deposit_state.description: Deposit state. Allowed values: - `pending`: deposit detected on blockchain/system, compliance not yet finished - `completed`: compliance check finished successfully - `rejected`: deposit failed compliance and must be handled manually - `replaced`: deposit transaction was replaced on the blockchain and should have a new transaction hash

clearance_state.description: Clearance state indicating the current status of the transaction clearance process. Allowed values: - `in_progress`: clearance process is in progress - `pending_admin_decision`: transaction is under manual review by Deribit admin - `pending_user_input`: user should provide additional information regarding the transaction - `success`: clearance process completed successfully - `failed`: clearance process failed, transaction is rejected - `cancelled`: transaction is cancelled (currently used only for withdrawals, meaning the withdrawal is cancelled) - `refund_initiated`: clearance process failed, transaction refund is initiated, funds are removed from Deribit balance (valid for deposits only) - `refunded`: clearance process failed, deposit amount is refunded back to the client (valid for deposits only)

currency_transaction_id.description: Transaction id in proper format for currency, `null` if id is not available

transfer_type.description: Type of transfer: `user` - sent to user, `subaccount` - sent to subaccount

transfer_state.description: Transfer state, allowed values : `prepared`, `confirmed`, `cancelled`, `waiting_for_admin`, `insufficient_funds`, `withdrawal_limit` otherwise rejection reason

mark_price.description: The mark price for the instrument

Available options: - `restricted_block_trades`: Limit the block_trade read the scope of the API key to block trades that have been made using this specific API key - `block_trade_approval`: Block trades created using this API key require additional user approval. Methods that use `block_rfq` scope are not affected by Block Trade approval feature

max_scope.description: Describes maximal access for tokens generated with given key, possible values: `trade:[read, read_write, none]`, `wallet:[read, read_write, none]`, `account:[read, read_write, none]`, `block_trade:[read, read_write, none]`, `block_rfq:[read, read_write, none]`. If scope is not provided, its value is set as none. Please check details described in [Access scope](#access-scope)

Multiplying it by future position's market price returns its estimated liquidation price. When cross collateral is enabled, this aggregated value is calculated by converting the sum of each cross collateral currency's value to the given currency, using each cross collateral currency's index.

The amount that will be subtracted/added to the secondary order will be rounded down to the contract size.

execution_instruction.description: Execution instruction of the quote. Default - `any_part_of` - `"all_or_none (AON)"` - The quote can only be filled entirely or not at all, ensuring that its amount matches the amount specified in the Block RFQ. Additionally, 'all_or_none' quotes have priority over 'any_part_of' quotes at the same price level. - `"any_part_of (APO)"` - The quote can be filled either partially or fully, with the filled amount potentially being less than the Block RFQ amount.

id.description: Unique identifier of the settlement instance

created_at.description: The timestamp when the settlement was created (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

updated_at.description: Timestamp of the last update of the settlement (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

amount.description: - Positive value means that since the previous settlement, the client has earned/bought the asset in the exchange and settlement direction is from exchange to the client. - Negative value means, since the previous settlement, the client has lost/sold the asset in the exchange and settlement direction is from client to deribit.

custody_balance.description: Custody balance of the user at the time of initiating the settlement

completed_at.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds since the Unix epoch) when the settlement or settlement instruction was completed. Only present if the status is `completed`.

unhosted_wallet.description: Indicates if the address belongs to an unhosted wallet
